### Title: 
Psychological Risk Assessment Services

### Description: 
The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) requires the services of a psychologist to provide psychological risk assessment services for federal offenders housed in provincial facilities in Newfoundland and Labrador. 

### Statement of Work:

The successful contractor must provide psychological risk assessment services in accordance with the objectives outlined below:

*   Conduct interviews and gather relevant information to compile comprehensive psychological risk assessment reports 
*   Integrate information obtained through testing, file review, clinical interview, and relevant staff member interviews into a comprehensive psychological risk assessment report 
*   Interpret test results using standardized norms from test publishers or authors 
*   Provide the Project Authority and designates with original test data 
*   Utilize clinician-rated tools that have been shown to be reliable and valid for assessing risk and needs of sex offender populations
*   Provide consultancy and training to correctional staff, including case conferences, the Interdisciplinary Mental Health Team or the Correctional Intervention Board and other related activities as requested.

### Terms and Conditions 
*   Services to be provided in English
*   Reports must comply with specific content and format requirements outlined in the Statement of Work
*   Contractor must provide regular updates to stakeholders and respond to any questions or concerns from offenders
*   All reports must be submitted in a timely manner, not exceeding 4 weeks from the date of referral.

### Evaluation Criteria:

The CSC will evaluate bids based on the following criteria:

*   Technical abilities and qualifications of the contractor 
*   Track record for delivering professional services in a correctional settings
*   Language and cultural awareness 
*   Ability to provide consultancy and training to correctional staff

### Indicative Requirements
 

*   Initial reporting period is 4 weeks; 
*   Ongoing reporting period is 2 years; 
*   1% annual increase
*   Ability to perform and submit reports on an as-need basis. 

Evaluations will be conducted on a case-by-case based. The overhead, margins and required license to operate have been identified and worked out in the original RFP (see document provided).

### Technician Qualification 
 

All contractors must meet the following minimum requirements to be considered for this opportunity:

*   PhD in Psychology (Clinical or Counseling) from a recognized institution
*   5 years experience in psychology, as a clinician or consultant
*   Strong analytical and communication skills
*   Bilingual (English-French)
